title: stopPrank seems to not correctly recognise that there is an active prank
body:
### Component

Forge

### Have you ensured that all of these are up to date?

- [X] Foundry
- [X] Foundryup

### What version of Foundry are you on?

forge 0.2.0 (91f69dd 2023-05-01T00:05:42.392562000Z)

### What command(s) is the bug in?

forge test

### Operating System

macOS (Apple Silicon)

### Describe the bug

Why does the below throw the new error recently introduced https://github.com/foundry-rs/foundry/pull/4827

It seems to me there is an active starting prank?

`
 ```
function testInvalidParametersConfigNotAllowed() public {
        vm.startPrank(address(factoryRegistryProxy));

        bytes memory custodianConfig = abi.encode(address(token), address(adapter), address(adapter));
        bytes memory feesControllerConfig = abi.encode(0.05 ether, 0, 0, 0, 0, 0.1 ether, 0.15 ether);

        vm.expectRevert(IProductFactory.INVALID_PRODUCT_PARAMS.selector);
        bulletFactory.deploy(
            governance,
            custodianConfig,
            feesControllerConfig,
            bytes('random'),
            bytes('random'),
            'name',
            'symbol'
        );
        vm.stopPrank();
    }
````
